entry.title: The Future of Procurement: Unlocking Value Through Business Accelerators with Klaus Fischer
entry.content:
The Future of Procurement: Unlocking Value Through Business Accelerators with Klaus Fischer

In today‚Äôs rapidly evolving business landscape, procurement is no longer just a back-office function‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic driver of growth, resilience, and innovation. This was the central theme of a recent episode of SAP‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Future of Procurement Podcast,‚Äù featuring Klaus Fischer, a veteran SAP leader and board advisor, whose career has spanned engineering, consulting, and transformative acquisitions. Fischer‚Äôs insights offer a roadmap for organizations seeking to unlock value by bridging finance and procurement, embracing technology, and fostering collaboration.

üèõÔ∏è From Engineering to Boardroom: The Journey of Transformation

Klaus Fischer‚Äôs story is emblematic of the evolution within procurement. Starting at SAP‚Äôs headquarters in Germany, Fischer‚Äôs career journey led him from engineering to strategic advisory roles, culminating in his pivotal involvement in SAP‚Äôs acquisition of Ariba‚Äîa move that redefined spend management and procurement for the enterprise. By integrating Ariba‚Äôs cloud-based capabilities with SAP‚Äôs robust ERP solutions, Fischer helped create a seamless, end-to-end platform that empowers organizations to optimize spend, drive compliance, and build resilient supply chains.

üîó Breaking Down Silos: The Power of Finance and Procurement Alignment

A recurring theme in the discussion was the critical need for CFOs and CPOs to break down organizational silos. In a climate marked by low growth, high costs, and regulatory complexity, Fischer emphasized that external pressures‚Äîgeopolitical shifts, tariffs, inflation, and supply chain disruptions‚Äîdemand agile, integrated responses. Internal challenges, such as data silos and manual processes, further hinder agility. The solution? Unified platforms and processes that connect finance and procurement, enabling real-time decision-making and accelerating value realization.

üöÄ Business Accelerators: Unlocking Value Quickly

Fischer introduced the concept of ‚Äúbusiness accelerators‚Äù‚Äîstrategic initiatives that rapidly unlock value across finance and procurement. Mastering working capital, for example, is more critical than ever. By connecting invoice-to-pay and invoice-to-cash processes, organizations can optimize cash flow, reduce risk, and improve key performance indicators like day sales outstanding (DSO) and day payable outstanding (DPO). Change management and governance are essential to overcoming resistance and ensuring successful adoption of new technologies and processes.

ü§ñ AI and Unified Data: The Next Frontier

Looking ahead, Fischer identified AI-powered automation and unified data as game-changers for procurement and finance. SAP‚Äôs embedded AI capabilities‚Äîspanning category management, guided sourcing, spend visibility, and financial close‚Äîenable organizations to achieve dramatic improvements in speed, accuracy, and strategic outcomes. The trustworthiness and precision of enterprise AI are paramount, especially when managing complex, high-value transactions.

üìà Real-World Outcomes and Forward-Looking Insights

When finance and procurement teams collaborate, companies realize tangible benefits: optimized savings, reduced risk, improved compliance, and more effective supplier onboarding. End-to-end workflows and internal controls ensure consistency and resilience, even amid global disruptions. Fischer‚Äôs forward-looking advice for leaders? Embrace agentic AI, automation, and integrated business processes to stay ahead in 2026 and beyond.

üí° Conclusion: Procurement Never Sleeps‚ÄîNeither Should Your Ideas

As organizations navigate uncertainty and transformation, the alignment of finance and procurement, powered by technology and strategic leadership, will be the key to unlocking sustainable growth. The future of procurement is collaborative, data-driven, and relentlessly innovative. What accelerators will your organization pursue next?

Share your thoughts, feedback, and ideas as we continue exploring the future of procurement together.

Please like, share, and subscribe!
Send feedback and questions to: TheFutureOfProcurement@sap.com

LISTEN to the Podcast HERE:

SAP: https://podcast.opensap.info/future-of-procurement/

entry.title: Re: Process Flow for Asset Intercompany Sale with Revenue...
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

Thank you for your feedback and follow-up

The AAPO149 error 'No depreciation area for receiving the revenue‚Äù happens when the system cannot locate a suitable depreciation area to post the revenue part of an inter company asset transfer.
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, this usually occurs if certain conditions are met.

The Transfer Variant used is not defined as with revenue, or the selected Transaction Type is not properly connected to a retirement with revenue process.

Please try the following:

In the Post Transfer app, across company codes in the same country, select 'with revenue' Transfer Variant 0001 ‚Äì Inter company transfer with revenue.

Use a Transaction Type such as 300  Retirement with revenue.

If no revenue needs to be posted, select the without revenue option and choose the appropriate transaction type, such as 310 ‚Äì Retirement without revenue.

For detailed guidance, please refer to SAP KBA 3471322 ‚Äì Error AAPO149 during inter-company code transfer posting (ABT1N), which also applies to the Public Cloud scenario:

SAP KBA-3471322 - Error AAPO149 occurred during inter-company code transfer posting in transaction ABT1N

2968929 ‚Äì Message AAPO149 occurred in an inter-company posting; the same root cause remedy is from a parallel article. SAP Support Portal-2968929 - Message AAPO149 occurred in transaction ABT1N for intro-company posting

Let me know how it goes

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: BigCommerce seamless integration with SAP Cloud ERP - Complete Setup & Demo Guide
entry.content:
Tired of Juggling Data Between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce? We‚Äôve Got You Covered!

Managing data and business processes across SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition) and BigCommerce can often be a challenging and time-consuming task ‚Äî especially when done manually or through custom-built integrations. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre excited to introduce a ready-to-use integration package powered by SAP Integration Suite, built to simplify and streamline your operations.

Designed specifically for B2C commerce scenarios, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures:

  • Seamless data synchronization between SAP and BigCommerce
  • Automated workflows for key business processes
  • A reduction in manual tasks and potential errors

In this blog, we‚Äôll start with a high-level overview of what the integration offers. Then, we‚Äôll walk you through a step-by-step guide to setting up the package ‚Äî so you can get your systems connected and running efficiently with minimal effort.

Note : SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package accelerator isn‚Äôt just limited to B2C. Partners can extend the integration to support B2B use cases as well, tailoring it to fit the needs of more complex business models. The package is built with extensibility in mind, so partners can enhance it further to accommodate specific business requirements or tailor it to specific industry needs. Partner can enhace the Integration Flows for bidirectional synchronization between BigCommerce & SAP Cloud ERP for the following entities:

  • Products, Price, Discounts & Tax
  • Product Variants ( Recommend customer project to leverage separate Products )
  • B2B Customer Master Data & Payment Settlement Flows
  • Enhance the use-case to cover Promotions and Classification

 

Overview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Integration Package:

SAP provides a variety of pre-built integration accelerators via the SAP Integration Suite, all accessible through the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Among these, we‚Äôve developed a dedicated BigCommerce integration accelerator that enables a seamless connection between your BigCommerce storefront and SAP Cloud ERP and its available with SAP Cloud Integration Suite Starter Edition and Standard Edition.

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures real-time data consistency across both platforms by synchronizing key business objects such as:

  •  üõí  Product information
  •  üì¶  Inventory levels/Product Stock
  • üí≤Product Prices & Discounts 
  •  üë§  Customer information

By automating critical business processes like order creation, cancellations, and returns, the integration reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and increases operational efficiency. It also synchronizes shipping and delivery details, helping you provide accurate and timely updates to customers ‚Äî a key to delivering a superior B2C customer experience.

The BigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud package is designed to integrate key end-to-end business processes between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce, enabling smooth, automated data flow and operational consistency across both platforms.

The following core business processes are supported out of the box:

üì¶ From SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce:

  • ‚úÖ Replicate Products ‚Äì Ensure accurate and up-to-date product information is reflected in your BigCommerce storefront.
  • üìä Replicate Product Stock ‚Äì Keep inventory levels in sync to avoid overselling or stockouts.
  • üí≤ Replicate Product Prices & Discounts ‚Äì Automatically update pricing and promotional details in BigCommerce.
  • üöö Replicate Delivery Details ‚Äì Provide timely and accurate shipping information to your customers via BigCommerce.

üõíFrom BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP:

  • üë• Replicate B2C Customers ‚Äì Capture and transfer customer data from BigCommerce to SAP, enabling centralized customer management.
  • üßæReplicate Orders ‚Äì Seamlessly transfer incoming sales orders into SAP for fulfillment and processing.
  • ‚ùå Replicate Order Cancellations ‚Äì Reflect cancelled orders in SAP for proper stock and financial reconciliation.
  • üîÅ Replicate Order Returns ‚Äì Automatically push return details from BigCommerce into SAP to streamline reverse logistics.

Together, these integration flows deliver a robust, automated B2C commerce experience, reducing manual interventions and ensuring your front-end and back-end systems remain in sync.

üöÄ How to Set Up the ‚ÄúBigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition‚Äù Package

Integrating BigCommerce with SAP Cloud ERP is now easier than ever ‚Äî thanks to the pre-built accelerator available on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. This step-by-step guide will help you configure and deploy the integration package using SAP Integration Suite, so your systems can work together seamlessly.

‚úÖPrerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

  • üîë  An SAP Partner Account with access to SAP Integration Suite (via SAP BTP ‚Äì Business Technology Platform).
  • üßæ Access to SAP Cloud ERP.
  • üõç  A BigCommerce Partner or Merchant Account.SAP Cloud ERP
  • üìò  Basic knowledge of SAP BTP, Integration Suite and BigCommerce . 
  • üåê  Access to SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • üìòDetailed Configure Guide - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Refer to BigCommerce Receiver Adapter | SAP Help Portal

 üõ†Ô∏è  Step 1: Set Up SAP Integration Suite instance using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) account.

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  2. Create a Subaccount and enable Integration Suite:
    • Navigate to your Global Account > Subaccount.
    • Create or open an Integration Suite instance.
    • Assign relevant entitlements and Assign relevant roles
    • Use the Booster Enable Integration Suite to automate setup or configure manually
    • for more details refer to sap help documentation SAP Integration Suite | SAP Help Portal

üì¶ Step 2: Import the BigCommerce Adapter Package into SAP Integration Suite

  1. Goto SAP Integration Suite instance
  2. Go to Discover tab.
  3. Search for ‚ÄúBigCommerce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite‚Äù.
  • Click ‚ÄúCopy‚Äù to add / move the package to your Design workspace.

  • To Configure BigCommerce Adapter Installation - Installing the BigCommerce Adapter is a prerequisite to use the Integration Content. For adapter installation, refer to the ‚ÄúBigCommerce Adapter Guide‚Äù and also refer to section Configure Adapter in Communication Channels and documents section in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

üîÑStep 3: Configure BigCommerce iFlows (Integration Flows) with API access relevant details.

  1. Go to Design > Integrations in the Integration Suite.
  2. Open the imported BigCommerce Integration Package.
  3. Select a relevant iFlow (e.g., Replicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition).
  4. Configure the necessary Externalized Parameters and Connections, referencing the detailed documentation for each Integration Flow.
  5. To Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP - the mandatory configurations which need to be performed in the SAP Cloud ERP before you can start implementing the configuration for BigCommerce API and configuring the Integration Content in SAP Integration Suite and for more details refer to section "Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  6. Sample configuration shown below.

      BigCommerce Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • BigCommerce Base Url: https://<yourshop>.myBigCommerce.com/
  • BigCommerce Secure Parameter: The name of the BigCommerce access token secure parameter 

       SAP Cloud ERP Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Base Url: https://<your-sap-s4-hana-instance-id>-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
  • Credential Name: The name of the SAP Cloud ERP secure parameter 

üß© Example Integration Flows:

  • BigCommerce ‚ûú SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition : Customer Replication, New Orders, Order Cancellations & Returns
  • SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition ‚ûú BigCommerce : Products, Inventory Synchronization, Stock Availability, Delivery Status

üöÄStep 4: Deploy and Test the Integration Package in Integration Suite

  1. Deploy selected iFlows from your Design workspace.
  2. Monitor from Monitor > Integrations > Message Processing Logs.
  3. Perform test transactions: for more details refer to Demo section in the blog
    • Place a test order in BigCommerce.
    • Monitor the message logs and confirm data replication in SAP Cloud ERP: Sales Orders, Business Partners, Product Catalog

üîß Extend or Customize the Package (Optional)

As a partner you can extend or tailor the integration through:

  • Customer Exits to plug-in your custom integration flows (Pre Exits and Post Exits in Intergration Flows)
  • Copy and modify the integration content.
  • Groovy scripts to customize payload mappings.
  • Content Modifiers to apply business logic.
  • Enhanced error handling and alerting.

 üí° Partner Tips & Monetization Opportunities

As an SAP Partner, you can:

  • üí° Extend the integration flows and Build new integration flows using SAP BigCommerce adapter
  • üìú  Demo your solution with real-time order sync and inventory updates, build a demo to show real-time sync between BigCommerce and SAP with custom business case.
  • üß∞ Buildc Multi-Tenant Integration Templates for reuse across customers.
  • üß† Leverage SAP Integration Advisor for intelligent mapping.
  • üí°  Add your branding, services, or vertical-specific enhancements.

High Level Demo Flow to showcase Order processing along with Master data replication.

  • Step 1 : View the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package in Integration Suite
  • Step 2: Show product in SAP Cloud ERP  (to be replicated to BigCommerce)
  • Step 3: Start replication of product in integration suite
  • Step 4: Show replicated product in BigCommerce and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product
  • Step 5: Log into BigCommerce as customer and browse through existing products
  • Step 6: Select the product replicated from SAP Cloud ERP and add to basket
  • Step 7: Enter the relevant details like payment and create order
  • Step 8: Check the order created in BigCommerce
  • Step 9: Replicate the order from BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 10: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as internal_sales_rep and look for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app and open the sales order and change the order date to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Step 11: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as shipping_specialist and open app ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù
  • Step 12: Enter shipping point and enter the sales order and shipping date as todays date and save , note down the Outbound Delivery ID
  • Step 13: Open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter Outbound Delivery ID and enter Actual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter picking quantity as 1 and save
  • Step 14 : Click on Post GI and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to Completely Processed. Note : show the SO Process flow of created order in SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 15 : Replicate the Outbound delivery from SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce.
  • Step 16: Open sales order in BigCommerce and show the OD created in SAP Cloud ERP reflected in metadata fields of Sales order and status of Sales Order is changed to fulfilled.

Detailed Demo steps:

BigCommerce Demo systems include the following systems - Integration Suite Tenant [along with BTP Sub-Account), SAP Cloud ERP, BigCommerce Admin Portal

Step 1:  Access the  Integration Suite tenant and view ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù integration package

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù -> ‚ÄúIntegration‚Äù
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , view the integration flows and details. 

Step 2: Access to SAP Cloud ERP System to show the replicating product master

  • Access system using URL SAP Cloud ERP system as Product Master Specialist
  • Login with user = prodmaster_specialist
  • Launch the App : ‚ÄúManage Product Master Data‚Äù  and search for Product ID  (sample product ID - TG11)
  • Note: in the demo product replication integration flow we are replicating only one product with product ID (sample product ID - TG11) and user could decide to replicate all products / sub-set of products, based on specific functional requirements.

Step 3: Start replication of product in Integration Suite

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Discover -> Integration (only first time)
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> copy the package
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  ,
  • Navigate to ‚Äúartifacts‚Äù and search for integration package ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
    • To deploy => click on the ‚Äú3 dots‚Äù of integration package and select ‚Äúdeploy‚Äù
    • Deploy would start the product replication from SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce

Step 4: Show replicated product in BigCommerce and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product

  • Login using URL : BigCommerce
  • Navigate to ‚ÄúProducts‚Äù
  • Check and prepare the product for selling to customer
    • Check the product is replicated
    • Check the Stock, Price (Default Price) , SKU (Product ID in S4 Public)
    • Check the product Inventory Details (Current Stock)  
    • Add the picture to publish 
    • Make sure to change the visibility status of product from "Disabled" to "Visible"
    • Note: only the product visibility status is "Visible" can be sold .
  • ‚ÄúSave‚Äù the product

Step 5: login to BigCommerce as customer and browse through existing products

Step 6: select the product replicated from SAP Cloud ERP and add to basket

  • Navigate to "Orders" -> "All Orders" 
  • Click on "Add" 
  • In the first step of order creation, enter the "Customer Info" , enter the "Existing Customer" / "Create New Customer" 
  • Search for the "Existing Customer" and Select the Currency
  • Enter the Billing Information 
  • Add the Product , Search for the existing replicated Product
  • Click on Next
  • Select the Fulfillment, 

Step 7: enter the relevant details like payment details

  • Select the Payment Provider, Card Type, Expiration Date details
  • Enter the Credit Card Holder Name, Credit Card Number, 
  • Click on "Save and Process Payment"  , order would be placed         

Step 8: check the order created in BigCommerce

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù -> "All Orders" 
  • Check the order created with status ‚ÄúAwaiting Fulfillment‚Äù , note down the ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Order ID‚Äù  , order ID would be used to search order created in SAP Cloud ERP system      
  • Note: SAP Cloud ERP Order ID can be found "Metafields" 

Step 9: replicate the order from BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Replication of orders in status Unfulfilled would be moved to SAP Cloud ERP .
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù      

Step 10: Log into SAP Cloud ERP system as Sales Representative

  • open for ‚ÄúManage Sales Order Version 2‚Äù app
  • open the sales order and check the order details
  • To create outbound delivery" follow detailed steps in step 11   
     

Step 11: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as Delivery shipping specialist and complete the delivery of Sales Order

  • open for ‚ÄúCreate outbound delivery with order reference‚Äù app

Step 12: Enter the key details like Shipping Point and Sales Order ...

  • enter shipping point sample as 3310 (select shipping point relevant for your use-case) and enter the sales order ID create earlier and Selection Date (select the relevant delivery date)
  • click on ‚Äúcontinue‚Äù and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù
  • note down the outbound delivery ID

Step 13: Delivery shipping specialist will pic the outbound delivery

  • open app ‚Äúpick outbound delivery‚Äù and enter ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù id and enter ‚ÄúActual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 22/10/2025) , enter ‚Äúpicking quantity‚Äù as 1 and click on ‚Äúsave‚Äù         

 

Step 14 : Delivery shipping specialist will Post Goods Issue for the corresponding outbound delivery

  • click on ‚ÄúPost GI‚Äù and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to ‚ÄúCompletely Processed‚Äù.      

 

Note : show the Sales Order ‚ÄúProcess flow‚Äù of created order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition for the corresponding order, the process flow gives visual representation of business entities created in the system (Order, Outbound Delivery, Invoice ‚Ä¶)

 

Step 15 : replicate the Outbound delivery from S4 public to BigCommerce .

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API‚Äôs
  • Search for integration Package ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce‚Äù  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact ‚ÄúReplicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù
  • Deploy the integration flow ‚ÄúReplicate Delivery Details from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to BigCommerce‚Äù
  • Replication of outbound delivery from SAP Cloud ERP system would be moved to BigCommerce and corresponding Order status would updated to ‚Äúfulfilled‚Äù in BigCommerce
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù => ‚ÄúIntegration and API‚Äôs‚Äù , check for ‚Äúlogs‚Äù         

Step 16: open sales order in BigCommerce and check the  status of Order, it should be changed from ‚ÄúAwaiting Fulfillment‚Äù to ‚ÄúShipped‚Äù

  • Navigate to ‚ÄúOrders‚Äù
  • With the successfully delivery , the order should be fulfilled and order status should be ‚ÄúShipped‚Äù ,
  • note the fields ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Order ID‚Äù  and ‚ÄúSAP Cloud ERP Outbound Deliveries‚Äù  in order would be copied from SAP Cloud ERP system , the custom fields can be found as part of "Metadata App" (as shown in the below snapshot)      

     

The above steps completes the High Level Demo Flow which showcase the order processing along with product master data replication.

Note: The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package covers Order Returns and Order Cancellation business scenarios along with Order Processing, please feel free to explore the other business process like Order Returns and Order Cancellation .

entry.title: Re: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone - Part 2
entry.content:
Hello @theodore_abitbol 

also the app-host with id e24ce92c-66bd-4c2a-ad20-ba911e15e26e does not exist on EU20. Have you deleted it again?
Please provide me a sample with an app-host Id without deleting it before I can try it out (and please send it as text as my text grabber from screenshots sometimes confuses 1 and l).

Extension landscapes allow to extend the limit of how many applications a Cloud Foundry environment can handle.
In general only your own apps e.g. a standalone app router or a broker will end up on the extension landscapes where you are on and their hostname will have the suffix in the domain. To deploy the CF API endpoint is the extension landscape.
However most SAP services like HTML5 repo, XSUAA, Workzone are hosted on the central landscape and their URLs in service keys will point to it and must be without the suffix, even for instances created on the extension landscape.

Removing the app-host-id segment (c1b1ef7a-d4a0-4649-9bee-a6d9f4ac6c32) from the URL is ok, if the remaining part is still unique. Internally it is always added to prevent ambiguous routings. The fact that removing it, makes the URL working indicates that the app-host-id has been wrong and maybe has been out of date. I could also not find the app-host with this ID so it seems to be gone as well.
Please verify if, the current ID in the URL fits to what has been deployed i.e. the main app-host Id. If it differs a sync has failed. You could try to enforce a sync in the Workzone provider configuration.

Best regards
Matthias

entry.title: MRP supply across multiple plants/storage locations
entry.content:
My customer does not do any assembly or production. They primarily do maintenance services and all the materials are ROH or MRO.

They have multiple plants that are the warehouse distribution centers to the multiple storage locations under each plant. 

Plant A0 --> SLOC A1, A2, A3
Plant B0 --> SLOC B1, B2, B3

When SLOC A1 needs more stock (based on reorder point or reservation), MRP generates an STR from A0. If A0 has no stock, the customer has built a custom utility to assess stock levels at the other Plants (B0) and other SLOCs (B1, B2, B3) and possibly create STR from those. 

The SLOCs are assigned to MRP areas. The customer is on ECC and is migrating to S4. Regarding these questions, please clarify if the functionality is available in ECC or only S4.

*** Inventory Planning ***

1) Is there any way to tell MRP which source plants/SLOCs to consider for supply? So with demand for SLOC A1, look at Plant A0. Then look at other plants or SLOCs.

2) If supply exists in Plant A0, create STR. If no supply, might be better to create a planned order from another source. What BADI is best to achieve this?

3) If above is not standard MRP,  can IBP solve for it?

4) Can S4 Cross-Plant Planning solution be useful in my scenario? Or SAP SCM Solutions add-on for cross-plant planning?

*** Inventory Optimization ***

The customer is struggling with optimizing their inventory across their plant network. They have not done any ABC or XYZ segmentation. All of their materials are either ND or reorder point planning. I will be introducing forecast-based planning. There would be less emergency STRs if the warehouse distribution plants had more optimal stock levels. I don't want to consider more advanced solutions like IBP, multi echelon planning, etc before shoring up their fundamentals. 

5) Is there any standard ECC or S4 functionality/reporting, with no additional licensing cost, that could help with proper planning of inventory across the network?

6) Probably a question for a separate thread, but in brief:  I'm struggling to understand the benefits of DDMRP over reorder point planning, at least for my scenario. Buffer concept seems to be analogous to reorder point safety stock level. I will surely check out DDMRP in my sandbox, but can someone articulate if DDMRP would provide any benefits for my non-manufacturing environment?

Much appreciated!

entry.title: Re: How are MT940 Transaction Keys Mapped to External Transaction Keys in SAP Bank Statement Process
entry.content: Hi, in the case you want to distinguish 4 different transaction types based on external transaction code, your bank should provide unique transaction code for each of that case. You are not creating external transaction codes - you read them from the statement file and assign your logic to it. If the bank does not provide unique codes, you can determine posting or processing rules based on some other information, like specific text that appears in the statement item. Please refer to following two blogs that explain the concepts is a better way: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/structured-format-for-field-86-in-mt940-bank-statement/ba-p/13418365 https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/ebs-configuration-of-search-string-part-1/ba-p/13251140

entry.title: How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID in SAP for Me
entry.content:
As an administrator managing user access in SAP for Me is a critical part of maintaining system security and operational efficiency. Whether you're onboarding new users as an admin, or adjusting access for existing ones, knowing how to properly assign and revoke authorization packages is essential. 

 

Why This Matters?

Authorization packages define what an S-user ID can access within the SAP for Me ecosystem‚Äîfrom support cases to license data, viewing systems, software download, etc. Keeping these permissions up to date ensures compliance, prevents unauthorized access, and streamlines user roles across your organization.

 

Steps:  

  1. Log in to SAP for Me using your S-user ID and password.  
  2.  In the SAP for Me homepage, click on ‚ÄúUsers & Contacts‚Äù tab under Dashboard at the left side of your screen.  
  3. Then, click on ‚ÄúManage Users & Authorization‚Äù card. Or simply go to‚ÄØUser Management.  
  4. Under the list of users, find the S-user ID to unassign the authorization package from. Or simply use the search field to search for the specific S-user ID and click on the magnifying glass to search.  
  5. Click on the user/S-user ID (not the checkbox).
  6. Click on the‚ÄØEXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES‚ÄØtab.  
  7. Click the Edit (Pencil) icon on the top right of that section. 
  8. Click on the checkbox in front of the Authorization Package(s) to be removed. 
  9. Click OK. 
  10. Click‚ÄØSave‚ÄØon the top right of the EXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES section. 

     

For more details, please refer to Knowledge Base Article: 2878696 - How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID - SAP for Me. 

 

Got More Questions?‚ÄØ 

The Customer Interaction Center is always ready to support you with any of the listed processes and is happy to assist with questions regarding case-related matters, SAP for Me navigation, S-user ID, or SAP Universal ID. 

 

Alternatively,‚ÄØplease‚ÄØfeel free to‚ÄØask‚ÄØus in the Q&A ‚ÄØ‚ÄØAll Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community‚ÄØand‚ÄØAll Questions in Support Services | SAP Community 

 

Don't‚ÄØMiss Out on Free Webcasts‚ÄØ 

We would like to invite you to our free webcasts, which we believe can help you get the best from your support in SAP. You can find all upcoming webcasts on‚ÄØhttps://events.sap.com/supportwebcasts/en/home.‚ÄØThese sessions are open to all the users and will revolve around hot topics in support today such as SAP for Me, Case Management, Universal ID, etc. Additionally, you can explore a range of CIC how-to videos at‚ÄØlearning.sap.com.‚ÄØPlease feel free to share this information with your colleagues. We are looking forward to your attendance.‚ÄØ 

 

Lastly, you may want to access all Customer Interaction Center Blogs here:‚ÄØ‚ÄØhttps://community.sap.com/t5/tag/CustomerInteractionCenter/tg-p/board-id/crm-blog-sap. 

 

Thanks‚ÄØfor reading! ‚ÄØWe hope you found this guide helpful.‚ÄØ

The Early Release Series webcasts cover features planned for the upcoming SAP Ariba and SAP Business Network quarterly release.  This platform, available to customers and partners, has a clear mission: deliver an interactive forum to engage with SAP product experts providing simple, direct answers to your most pressing questions.  There is a different session for each product area with content tailored for the specific audience:

entry.title: ATP in Sales Orders no longer considers QI stock with EWM
entry.content:
Hi,

We've recently moved from stock room management to EWM (embedded). 

We've noticed since moving that stock in quality inspection in the EWM warehouse is not considered in the availability when running ATP in sales orders, so is pushing out availability dates to the full lead time.

The Scope of check has not changed and I can see that it still thinks it is looking at stock in Quality Inspection, but when looking at the Availability Overview it is clear that only unrestricted stock is being considered.

When viewing MD04, the QI stock is included in the total available quantity at the top of the screen, but it does not show the QM lots as part of the MRP elements as it did previously.

Has anyone else experienced this issue when moving to EWM?

entry.title: How to prevent techinical users to not perform a dialog login in PI/PO
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

How can we prevent SAP PO technical users from doing a dialog login. Could you please share the approach and steps to be followed.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to prevent techinical users to not perform a dial...
entry.content:
The most effective approach is to configure technical users as Service users rather than Dialog users. Service users are designed for technical integrations and system-to-system communication 

If the requirement is that no end users should be able to login to the SAP Application Server JAVA, check SAP KBA 2151943 .

In order to prevent dialog logons you can lock multiple users following below steps:

1.Go to http://<host>:<port>/useradmin
2.Search for the user while leaving the field empty
3.Chose the button 'Go'
4.This will output all the users
5.Select all the users and deselect the one don't want
6.Choose button 'Lock'
7.It will prompt to write a reason for locking the users. The system sends this text to the user, if it gets enabled e-mail notification. The text is also stored in the user's account history.
8.Enter a text and choose the Lock button.

2479106 - How to Lock all users explicitly in SAP NetWeaver AS Java

entry.title: Re: post method fails with "Unexpected text for XML-ABAP...
entry.content: It's Atom XML. The problem is that you don't show the part corresponding to your data. In Atom XML, the entity data is shown after "<content type="application/xml">". I don't know your OData entities and I'm not familiar with Atom XML. Atom XML was never used in all my projects. Could you request the result in JSON? (append ?$format=json to your URI) Also, show the part of your entity which corresponds to the XML. In short, describe your entity and show the entity data in the result.

entry.title: How to download supplier and customer invoice in Mass (PDF copies)?
entry.content:
There is a requirement to know how to download supplier and customer invoices in mass as PDF copies.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to download supplier and customer invoice in Mass...
entry.content:
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, multiple PDFs can be downloaded from Billing Documents using API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/GetPDF. The action itself can be called for only one billing document, however, multiple service requests can be triggered to download PDFs massively by coding a loop logic in the external system.

Refer to the following documentation for full information:

  • 3208892 - How to mass download PDF invoices in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me
  • API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/GetPDF - Get PDF of Billing Document | SAP Help Portal 
  • Solved: Mass download billing document pdf output - SAP Community
  • Solved: Printing and attaching the invoice form - SAP Community
  • Mass Download of Billing Documents Output for Commercial Projects (5BP) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

entry.title: Set up Signavio Process Insights configuration
entry.content:
SAP Signavio Process Insights configuration

SAP Signavio Process Insights is a cloud-based tool, that helps companies understand how their business processes are working, using real data from their systems (like SAP CRM, ECC, EWM, SRM, S/4HANA, TM , Ariba etc.,).

It automatically analyses your processes; Example: How orders are created, approved, and delivered and shows where things are slowing down, getting stuck, or not following best practices.

Then, it gives you clear insights and recommendations on how to fix or improve those areas.

SAP Signavio process insights to SAP S/4 HANA system.

Source: SAP

SAP Signavio Process Insights connects to on-premise SAP system to the BTP cloud using the ST-PI plug-in. It must have the required ST-PI version installed and set up an encrypted HTTPS outbound connection to SAP BTP. Data transfer is triggered directly from your on-premise system.

There are two ways of connecting a source system to SAP Signavio Process Insights. You connect your SAP on-premise source system directly to SAP Signavio Process Insights or you use and intermediate system to connect your SAP on-premise source system to SAP Signavio Process Insights. Here we are discussing on source system directly to process insights.

Note: ST-PI plug-in versions must be updated regularly. SAP Signavio Process Insights only supports the latest available version, as well as the two preceding versions.

As a part of onboarding process, following activities need to perform

  1. Login to S/4 HANA, make sure ST-PI , ST-A/PI plugins up to date

Plug-In

Supported Plug-In Version

Notes Required for SAP On-Premise Systems

ST-PI

7.4 SP32

SAP Note 3659887 

7.4 SP31

SAP Note 3626118 

ST-A/PI

01W SP2

SAP Note 3611533 

 

 SAP Note 3600553 

 

SAP Note 3600554 

01W SP1

SAP Note 3537655 

 

SAP Note 3530899 

 

 SAP Note 3530940 

  1. The following users must exist in all S/4 HANA systems with respective roles

User

Role Template

User to set up system connection & schedule data collection

SAP_SDF_PINS_SETUP

Background user to perform the actual data collection

SAP_SDF_PINS_BACKGROUND_DC

Expert user to troubleshoot the system connection and data collection

SAP_SDF_PINS_SETUP_EXPERT

SAP_SDF_PINS_BACKGROUND_DC

SAP_SDF_PINS_SETUP

  1. Subscribe to the Application

Login to BTP with global admin access, and navigate to boosters. https://<cockpit_region>.cockpit.btp.cloud.sap and navigate to boosters. From your global account in the SAP BTP cockpit, choose Boosters.

 Search for SAP Signavio Process Insights.

The booster wizard loads, and the prerequisite checks run automatically.

When the check has completed successfully, choose Next.

In the Select Scenario step, specify whether you want to create a new subaccount or select an existing one.

If you select an existing subaccount, Cloud Foundry must already be enabled for this subaccount.

In the Configure Subaccount step, provide the details for your subaccount.

Select the plan you want to subscribe to based on your entitlements. Only those plans that you're entitled to are available.

 

Name

Plan

Type

Description

 

 

SAP Signavio Process Insights (technical name: process-insights-api)

test

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have the SAP Signavio Process Insights, base package. Select this plan when you want to subscribe to the application in your subaccount intended for quality and validation purposes.

 

 

SAP On-Premise Systems Only

 

 

standard

Subscription

 

 

standard-new

Subscription

 

 

rise

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have access to the solution as part of your RISE with SAP package. Select this plan as a RISE with SAP customer.

 

 

SAP On-Premise Systems Only

 

 

partner

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have access to the solution as an SAP partner with a cloud test and demonstration license for SAP Signavio Process Insights. Each license entitles you to one tenant and one application subscription.

 

 

partner-new

Subscription

This application plan is available if you have access to the SAP Signavio Process Insights solution as an SAP partner with a cloud test and demonstration license from the SAP Signavio Process Insights and Intelligence package. Each license entitles you to one tenant and one application subscription.

 

 

test-new

Subscription

This application plan is available for the sandbox environment for SAP Signavio Process Insights and Intelligence package. Select this plan when you want to subscribe to the application in your subaccount intended for quality and validation purposes.

 

 

standard

Instance

This service plan is available in addition to the application plan for your subscription. The service instance that uses this service plan is created automatically when you run the booster.

 

 
  

Each region consists of multiple data centres in different locations.

In the Add Users step, configure the authentication service for users, typically identified by email address, who will be working with the SAP Signavio Process Insights application.

Select two identity providers, one for the authentication of platform users and one for the authentication of application users.

The booster now runs and the processing progress of the various tasks is shown.

Once the booster has completed, open the SAP Signavio Process Insights application as follows:

Choose Navigate to Subaccount.

Choose Services  Instances and Subscriptions.

Under Subscriptions, go to the table that contains the applications to which your subaccount is currently subscribed.

Choose the link to the SAP Signavio Process Insights application. This is the URL of the application.

You've now prepared your subaccount for SAP Signavio Process Insights and are ready to connect a source system to your cloud tenant.

To be able to connect an SAP on-premise system, you need the details of the service key that was created with the service instance

In the SAP BTP cockpit, navigate to your subaccount and choose Instances and Subscriptions.

Under Instances, select the service instance for SAP Signavio Process Insights.

Under Service Keys, choose the link for the key that was created for the service instance.

Copy or download the JSON so you have the details on hand.

  1. Login to S/4 HANA system

Import the digi certificates

DigiCertGlobalRootG2 & DigiCertRSA4096RootG5

Download the certificates from below link

https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/setup-managed-services/setup-abap/setup-strust.html?locale=en-US&anchorId=section_1414159140

  1. Set up integration with SAP Signavio Process Insights

T-code:  /n/SDF/PINS_SETUP

Note: If you're using an ST-PI version that's no longer supported by SAP Signavio Process Insights, you use transaction /n/SDF/ALM_SETUP (Set up integration with SAP Cloud ALM) instead. The integration name can contain a maximum of 14 characters.

Choose Create/Update Destination and copy and paste the service key details to specify the details for the HTTPS destination of your SAP Signavio Process Insights cloud tenant destination.

Your administrator in SAP BTP can get the service key details as outlined under Getting Your Service Key Details (SAP On-Premise Systems).

You can also specify the details of your HTTPS destination manually as outlined in the following table:

  1. In the SAP BTP cockpit, navigate to your subaccount and choose Instances and Subscriptions.

Under Instances, select the service instance for SAP Signavio Process Insights.

Under Service Keys, choose the link for the key that was created for the service instance.

Copy or download the JSON so you have the details on hand

 

Property

Description

Token Endpoint

Enter the url value from the service key.

Note

When you enter the token endpoint URL, it must have the following format:

https://<identifier>.authentication.<region ID>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

This ensures that the HTTPS destination has the required prefix path.

Client ID

Enter the clientid value from the service key.

Secret

Enter the clientsecret value from the service key.

Proxy Host

If your organization uses a proxy, enter the host name and port number specific to your proxy.

If your proxy uses authentication, enter the user name and password specific to your proxy.

You can get this information from your organization's IT department or specialist.

Proxy Port

Proxy User

Proxy Password

Root URL

Enter your registration target.

Enter the application base URL (uri property) for the SAP Signavio Process Insights service. As before, your administrator can provide these details from the service key created in SAP BTP.

Note

When you enter the uri into the Root URL field, it must have the following pattern:

https://bpi-pia-core-api.cfapps.<region ID>.hana.ondemand.com

  1. Connect the system to the SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant.

Enter your background user and start data collection. Enter the background user that has the required PFCG role SAP_SDF_PINS_BACKGROUND_DC assigned in your source system and is authorized to perform the data collection.

To start the data collection, schedule the jobs for collecting data and getting the data collection settings from SAP Signavio Process Insights

Option

When to Use

Get Settings Once

¬∑       For testing data collection:

Before you can test data collection for one performance indicator, the data collection settings need to be fetched from SAP Signavio Process Insights once.

¬∑       After updating the data collection settings in SAP Signavio Process Insights:

If you've updated the data collection settings in SAP Signavio Process Insights and don't want to wait for the autodiscovery job to run again, you can use this option instead.

¬∑       For connecting quality systems:

To verify data collection in your quality system, a single data collection is usually sufficient. Similarly, you also need to fetch the data collection settings only once.

¬∑       If you're using the RISE with SAP package:

As a RISE with SAP customer, you're entitled to one data collection run only. For this run, you only need to fetch the data collection settings once.

Get Settings Hourly

Once you've tested data collection, you can schedule the data collection settings to be fetched every hour.

Test Data Collection

To test data collection for a single performance indicator and verify it works:

To test data collection, you first need to get the data collection settings once from SAP Signavio Process Insights. Next, you select a performance indicator ID and choose Test Data Collection. If the collection test was successful, a green checkmark is displayed.

Tip

If you're unsure for which performance indicator there's collectable data in your system, you can try using the Aggregated transaction and report usage (PETST03N01) performance indicator to test data collection.

Setup Maximum Processing Time

To set the duration for sending collected data for performance indicators before a timeout occurs:

By default, the sending of collected data can take up to one hour for each performance indicator. If your system contains large volumes of data or if your connection is slow, one hour can be insufficient to send all data, resulting in a timeout.

If you encounter data collection issues due to timeouts, SAP Support might ask you to increase the maximum processing time.

Schedule Data Collection

Once you've tested data collection for one performance indicator successfully, you can schedule it to run hourly for all performance indicators.

Restart Data Collection

To restart data collection if there are issues:

If your initial data collection didn't work as expected and the results in SAP Signavio Process Insights are incomplete or faulty, you can adjust your settings and then restart data collection for all performance indicators.

Delete Jobs

If you're using the RISE with SAP package:

After your one-time data collection was successful, you can use this option to delete the jobs for data collection and data collection settings. In this way, you can stop data collection from running unnecessarily while your system stays connected to your SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant and business users can continue to analyze the previously connected data.

Disconnect System

If you're using an intermediate system and have connected your quality system:

You can use this option if you want to disconnect your quality system from the intermediate system and connect it to your production system instead.

Proceed like this:

a.      Use this option to disconnect your quality system from SAP Signavio Process Insights and delete the jobs for data collection and its settings.

b.      Delete the data collected from your quality system in SAP Signavio Process Insights as outlined under Deleting Performance Indicator Data.

Now, you're ready to reuse the integration and HTTPS destination you've created.

c.      Exchange the RFC destination to your quality system with the RFC destination to your production system in step 2.

d.      Connect your production system in step 4 and start data collection in step 5.

Delete HTTPS Destination

If you want to stop using SAP Signavio Process Insights for the connected system:

You can use this option if you would like to delete the jobs for data collection and its settings, disconnect the system, and delete the HTTPS destination to your SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant.

Note

When you delete the HTTPS destination to your SAP Signavio Process Insights tenant, the data that was previously collected is still available in SAP Signavio Process Insights. For more information about how to delete this data, see Deleting Performance Indicator Data.

  1. You've now set up the direct connection between your SAP on-premise system and the cloud tenant for SAP Signavio Process Insights. You can use transaction SM59 in your SAP on-premise system to check that the connection is appearing under HTTP Connections to External Server.
  1. Background Jobs in SAP On-Premise Systems

CRBPA:AUTODISCOVERY

This job runs every hour by default. It requests the latest data collection settings from SAP Signavio Process Insights system. The data collection settings determine for which performance indicators data is to be collected and how often it is collected.

The job also requests the descriptions for the master data that's collected with the process performance data for performance indicators. However, these descriptions are requested once every 30 days only.

CRBPA:DC_CONTROLLER

This job runs every minute. It checks the available work processes, triggers data collection, and sends the data collected to SAP Signavio Process Insights.

The CRBPA:DC_CONTROLLER job only collects data for those performance indicators that are on the list the SAP on-premise system received from SAP Signavio Process Insights as a response to the latest request from the CRBPA:AUTODISCOVERY job. It also collects data based on the frequency defined for each performance indicator. To control resource consumption in your connected systems, this job only uses up to one background process and three dialog processes.

  1. Provide users with access to system data in SAP Signavio Process Insights either manually through BTP or via IAS using Okta SSO.

entry.title: Optimizing Accessibility for Cognitive Disabilities
entry.content:
Millions of people struggle with focus, memory, and processing complex information every day. In fact, the World Health Organization reports that one in three people worldwide lives with a neurological condition that can affect cognitive function [1]. While these challenges can be permanent for some, designing for people with cognitive disabilities benefits everyone. It helps anyone dealing with temporary or situational challenges that impact their ability to focus, such as trying to complete a task when fatigued or under high emotional stress, or simply trying to learn something new in a noisy, crowded environment.

A smiling woman with long hair and glasses, wearing a headset, sits in front of a computer. Text reads: "1 in 3 people worldwide live with a neurological condition that can affect cognitive functioning. SAP designs for neurodivergent people. Check out our tips for wayfinding and orientation, motion content and more!

Design for Accessibility is Design for Everyone

When we design with accessibility in mind, we‚Äôre not just checking a box, we‚Äôre creating digital experiences that are easier to use for everyone. Making interfaces clear, predictable, and easy to navigate doesn‚Äôt just help some users; it makes products better across the board.

5 Tips to Optimize Accessibility for Those with Cognitive Disabilities

Supporting users with cognitive disabilities means creating clear, predictable interfaces that support diverse ways of thinking and processing information. The guidance in‚ÄØSAP‚Äôs Accessibility Design Tools, Second Edition, and the‚ÄØInclusive Research Handbook‚ÄØhelps turn this awareness into practical steps.‚ÄØWith these resources in mind,‚ÄØhere are five tips to help you get started:

1. Prioritize Clarity

  • Prioritize clarity with plain language, simple sentences, and familiar terms.
  • Reinforce meaning visually and verbally by using clear labels and pairing icons with text.
  • Why? Unclear instructions or unfamiliar icons can cause confusion, which can lead to errors or task abandonment.

2. Help users understand their location

  • Help users understand their location by keeping important details, like task summaries or form labels, consistently visible.
  • Use fixed headers or status indicators so users don‚Äôt lose track of their place in a process.
  • Why?‚ÄØUsers might forget the context, instructions, or earlier steps in a task, which can lead to errors or incomplete tasks.

3. Design clean, simple interfaces

  • Design clean, simple interfaces with a clear visual hierarchy.
  • Group related content together and reduce visual noise.
  • For potentially distracting elements like animations or background sounds, provide clear and easy-to-find controls so users can pause, stop, or hide them.
  • Why? Unexpected motion or sounds and visual clutter can be overwhelming for people with cognitive and sensory disabilities, making it hard to concentrate and possibly experience anxiety. Giving users direct control allows them to create a customized space that fits their needs, improving comfort and helping them stay on task.

4. Maintain a predictable experience

  • Maintain consistent navigation, layout, and terminology to ensure a predictable experience.
  • Use progressive disclosure and clearly announce changes in advance ‚Äî for example, through banners or tooltips.
  • Why?‚ÄØInconsistent patterns and sudden changes can be stressful and confusing. A predictable interface helps users build mental models and navigate with confidence, which can reduce anxiety and increase task focus.

5. Break tasks into simple steps

  • Break tasks into small, simple, manageable steps.
  • Use visual aids like progress bars, checklists, and grouped content to clarify the structure.
  • Include clear instructions, plain language, familiar icons, and specific feedback messages.
  • Why?‚ÄØA disorganized or complex interface can increase cognitive load, making it harder to stay focused, remember previous steps, and track progress. Clear structure and communication reduce overwhelm and help users complete tasks more confidently.‚ÄØ

How SAP Designs with Accessibility in Mind

Technology keeps changing, but our commitment to Accessibility remains constant. We're focused on ensuring innovation moves forward without leaving anyone behind. To achieve that goal, we are actively innovating how accessibility considerations can be integrated in all parts of the Product Development Lifecycle, especially in early phases like design.

Want to dig deeper? Explore SAP's Accessibility Design Tools, Second Edition

References:

1. World Health Organization. (2024, March 14). Over 1 in 3 people affected by neurological conditions, the leading cause of illness and disability worldwide.

entry.title: SAP Improvement 2H 2025 - impact for Proxy rights on supported tools
entry.content:
On 2H 2025 release, SAP referred in the following KBA https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3667810 that using proxy rights to access below tools will be non-supported:

Modules that Don't Support Proxy AccessModuleWas supported before 2H 2025?

SAP SuccessFactors Learning

No

Note: Before 2H 2025 there was a Learning proxy module option, but it wasn‚Äôt functioning. After 2H 2025, the Learning option is no longer available.

SAP SuccessFactors Platform

Yes

Note: The following features and tools have stopped supporting Proxy access:
  • Configuration Transport Center
  • Instance Refresh
  • Integration Center
  • Security Center
  • Proxy Management
  • Proxy Import
  • Security Permission Reports
  • Manage RBP Admin and Super Admin Access
  • Privacy Statement in user settings
  • Reset Password in user settings

The change of proxy access in supported and non-supported tools has an huge impact on customers current Proxy usage.

Customers have already requested in the following SAP Improvement 
https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/359099/?section=sectionDetails - "Return back the permission to access to the Integration Center under the proxy" to not proceed with this changes or rethink the deliver until 2H 2025 is delivered in production in November 2025.

If this is delivered in 2H 2025 then there are huge impact in customers such has:
- being able to use proxy to troubleshoot issues related to the listed tools;
-being able to proxy technical users to schedule and run IC jobs;
- Being able to proxy SUPERADMIN user in case of emergency and not able to access the tools listed;
- Not able to proxy Technical users and preform any RBP access management;
- Processes defined by customers impacted due to system behavior over proxy.

Customers are not able to opt-out this system behavior.

This deliver should be reconsidered, we suggest customers vote on the SAP Improvement mentioned in order to raise concern over this 2H 2025 automatically on change for the release.

entry.title: Re: The workflow event trace is active but doesn't trace anything (transactions SWELS/SWEL)
entry.content:
The screen of SWELS is badly designed, it shows that it's active but in fact it may be inactive according to the time range defined in the restriction, which by default makes the trace valid during one hour after the activation. After this delay, the field "Event trace switched on" remains active.

It's very disturbing.

This behavior is explained in the note 2498410 - SWEL doesn't capture event even though the event was raised - SAP for Me.

So, remember, don't trust the "active" flag, always check the restrictions.

Also, if you're working extensively with the trace, go to the restrictions and define a much bigger interval (till the end of the day for instance):

NB: if you really don't like this restriction feature and want to rely only on the "active" flag of the initial screen, you may ignore the restrictions by entering a huge time range:

entry.title: Syncing Hiring manager back with position in Onboarding
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a scenario where we are defaulting the Manager's Manager (HM+) to the Hiring Manager operator field in RCM. We then map Hiring Manager to Manager ID field in Job Info in Recruit to Hire Mapping.

However, we are noticing that in ONB the Manager ID field is not being updated with the actual manager of the position and is keeping the mapped value (HM+). Our expectation was that based on position / job sync rules and position management settings, this would be populated with the correct manager but SAP has indicated this is not expected behavior.

Has anyone encountered this or found a way to populate this on initiation of ONB correctly? We do not have New Hire Data Review enabled so new hire tasks like welcome message are being assigned to the wrong user. 

Note: SAP indicated we could not use a business rule in Job Info because Job Info is not visible during Personal Data Collection, so rules will not be executed

Looking for any recommendations or workaround.
